name: EnMasse
body:
The EnMasse project provides the required tools and services for deploying and running a scalable messaging service on [Openshift](https://www.openshift.com/). Running on Openshift means that you can either run EnMasse on your own cluster locally or in the cloud. You can also run EnMasse on [Openshift Origin](https://www.openshift.org/), which is the upstream community project.

EnMasse uses the [Qpid Dispatch Router](https://qpid.apache.org/components/dispatch-router/index.html), a high performance AMQP message router, in order to scale to a large number of clients and messages. For store-and-forward semantics, EnMasse uses message brokers such as [Apache ActiveMQ Artemis](https://activemq.apache.org/artemis/). 

Some long-term goals for EnMasse:
   * Support different communication patterns like request-response, pub-sub and events
   * Support for a variety of different protocols like AMQP, MQTT, HTTP(1.1 & 2), CoAP and STOMP
   * Multi-tenancy
   * Scalability
   * Elasticity without service interruption
   * Simple setup and management of messaging clusters

EnMasse itself consists of infrastructure components that makes deployment and scaling easier. Here are some of the parts that make up EnMasse:
   * A simple configuration format encapsulating details of message brokers and routers. The configuration can be split into a cluster admin config and application developer config.
   * A set of templates for creating brokers manually or automatically based on a single configuration.
   * A set of agents running as part of the cluster and acts on changes to the configuration
      * Configures the router network.
      * Generates and starts brokers for addresses marked as store-and-forward and attaches volumes for persistence.
   * Templates for quickly setting up EnMasse on Openshift.

The project is still in it's infancy, so there are currently a lot of TODO items that are being worked
on in addition to the occasional bugfixing:

   * Supporting more message brokers (currently ActiveMQ and ActiveMQ Artemis only)
   * Stabilizing configuration format
   * Downscaling brokers for topics without loosing messages
   * Scalability and performance testing

To get started, you must have an openshift project setup. Use either [Openshift Online](https://www.openshift.com/) to run it in the cloud, or [Openshift Origin](http://openshift.org) if you want to run the community edition yourself. Once you have a project setup, have a look at [Setting up EnMasse](https://github.com/enmasseproject/openshift-configuration#setting-up-enmasse) for how to setup a messaging service.
